case_title: Nazar Hussain vs State/Munir Hussain And Other

accussed_details.name: Munir Hussain
allegation: Claiming hereditary appointment as Lambardar under rule 19(2) of Land Revenue Rules, 1968

accussed_details.name: Ali Haider
allegation: Claiming appointment based on majority community representation and land ownership

prosecution: Malik Ghulam Shabbir Khokhar (for Nazar Hussain)

complaint_summary: Dispute over appointment of Lambardar for Chak No. 315/TDA following the death of Wali Muhammad, a temporary Lambardar.
investigation_summary: District Collector Layyah appointed Nazar Hussain as Lambardar under rule 17 of the Land Revenue Rules, 1968. Appeals and revisions were filed by Munir Hussain and Ali Haider, leading to multiple judgments and remands by higher authorities. Commissioner D.G. Khan accepted Munir Hussain's appeal and set aside the District Collector's order, which was later restored by the Board of Revenue.
judgment_summary: The court restored the District Collector's order dated 19.1.1995 appointing Nazar Hussain as Lambardar, setting aside the orders of Commissioner D.G. Khan and Member Board of Revenue. The rule of primogeniture was deemed repugnant to Islamic injunctions, and claims were evaluated on merit. Community representation and land ownership were key considerations.
Decision_or_verdict: Revision accepted; Nazar Hussain reinstated as Lambardar.
legal_arguments: Rule of primogeniture declared repugnant to Islamic injunctions.
District Gazetteer of Muzaffargarh used to differentiate between Dhool and Kharral communities.
Choice of District Collector upheld unless patently perverse.
Majority community representation and land ownership favored Nazar Hussain.
key_issues: Validity of rule of primogeniture under Islamic injunctions.
Merit-based evaluation of candidates for Lambardar post.

legal_terms.Lambardar: Village headman responsible for revenue collection and administrative duties.
legal_terms.Primogeniture: Right of the eldest son to inherit his father's position.

words_and_phrases.Zar-e-Bart: Surety amount required for Lambardar appointment.

summary_vector_notes: Dispute over Lambardar appointment resolved by restoring District Collector's choice of Nazar Hussain. Rule of primogeniture invalidated, and claims evaluated on merit. Community representation and land ownership considered.

facts.district_collector_decision: Appointed Nazar Hussain as Lambardar on 19.1.1995 under Rule 17 of the West Pakistan Land Revenue Rules, 1968
facts.commissioner_decision: Accepted appeal of Munir Hussain, rejected appeal of Ali Haider, and set aside District Collector's order on 27.11.1996

procedural_history.revision_petitions: Filed by Nazar Hussain and Ali Haider in Board of Revenue, dismissed on 5.9.2000
procedural_history.review_petitions: Filed by Nazar Hussain and Ali Haider, dismissed on 7.6.2003
procedural_history.writ_petitions: Nos. 3936/03 and 3629/03 filed in Lahore High Court, Multan Bench, accepted; case remanded to Member Board of Revenue, Punjab, Lahore

nazar_hussain.rule_17_application: Appointment under Rule 17 of West Pakistan Land Revenue Rules, 1968
nazar_hussain.primogeniture_rule: Rule 19(2) declared repugnant to Injunctions of Islam

munir_hussain.hereditary_claim: Son of deceased Lambardar Wali Muhammad
munir_hussain.support: Reports of Revenue field staff in favor

court_findings.primogeniture_rule: Struck down as repugnant to Injunctions of Islam

candidate_comparison.nazar_hussain: Preferred due to majority community representation and satisfactory performance
candidate_comparison.ali_haider: Not recommended due to personality concerns
candidate_comparison.munir_hussain: No preferential treatment due to temporary Lambardar status of father

final_decision.member_board_of_revenue_order: Already set aside by High Court
